alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 11:52PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Arizona, including the following counties, Maricopa and Pinal. * WHEN...Until 300 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1152 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Tortilla Creek, First Water Creek, La Barge Creek, and Lewis and Pranty Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Canyon Lake, Tortilla Flat, and the Apache Trail. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Boaters camping overnight at the water`s edge, should be prepared for a sudden flow of water pouring into Canyon Lake.
